== Definition ==


Let <math display="inline">S = \left\{ 1, \ldots, 12 \right\}</math> we define the following function <math display="inline">C : \mathbb{W} \times \mathbb{P}\left( S \right)  \to \mathbb{W}</math> for any root note <math display="inline">R \in \mathbb{W}</math> and set of intervals <math display="inline">X \subseteq \mathbb{P}\left(S\right)</math>, the set of chord tones is defined as:<math display="block">C\left(R, X\right) \stackrel{\mathtt{D}}{ = } \left\{ n: (n \in \mathbb{W}) \land (I\left(n, R\right) ~\%~ 12 \in X) \right\}</math>A chord is any subset of <math display="inline">C\left(R, X\right) </math> who's cardinality is at least 2.
